content: A few years ago, I was interviewing for a UX Designer role. Now that I have children, one part of that interview boils my blood. Interviewer: “What do you like to do in your spare time?” Me: “Well, actually I enjoy designing stuff.” Interviewer: “That’s good, because the last candidate we interviewed said he just liked to play with his kids. We prefer someone who actually reads or thinks about design in his spare time.” Are you kidding me? I didn’t realize it then, but now that I look back, I see the egregiousness of that question. What I do in my spare time is my own business.
